message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper deals with the problem of aligning word embeddings in multiple languages to a common space, which is a common task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a novel formulation for better alignment, which involves learning composable mappings, which is a machine learning task and falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves the use of unsupervised learning techniques, which is a subfield of AI and falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves the use of word embeddings, which is a common technique in computer vision and falls under the category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper involves the use of neural networks, which is a subfield of machine learning and falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
